1.text: Scrub potatoes and rinse well with cold water.

2.text: Remove excess moisture by drying potatoes with a clean tea towel or white paper towels, if baking in a conventional oven.

4.text: Cut off any bruised or bad spots, if required.

5.text: Pierce the potatoes once or twice with a fork.

6.text: Rub the potatoes with olive oil to coat evenly.

7.text: Bake potatoes at 425 °F (218 °C) for 45 to 60 minutes.

9.text: Season the potatoes with olive oil, salt and pepper (optional).

10.text: Wrap the potatoes in aluminum foil.

11.text: Bake at 425 °F (218 °C) for ~45 to 60 minutes, or 400 °F (204 °C) for 60 to 70 minutes.

13.text: Place the potatoes in a microwave-safe dish and microwave on high for 5 minutes.

14.text: Turn the potatoes over and microwave for an additional 3 to 5 minutes.

17.text: Scrub potatoes but do not dry.

18.text: Place in slow cooker, cover, and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until tender.
